title: [K-12] Online Ecopsychology-Based Mathematics Inquiry: Problem-Solving in Environmental Contexts

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Arithmetic Operations and Understanding of Simple Equations
context.additional_context: Students explore inaccessible environmental contexts through VR scenarios and real-time data visualization tools, with a focus on developing mathematical modeling skills

learning_goals: Learners can apply ecological psychology principles to mathematically model real-world environmental issues (e.g., park design, resource allocation)
Learners can complete small-group projects using online collaboration tools and perform statistical analysis based on collected data
Learners can apply ratio/proportion concepts to solve problems derived from virtual environment simulations (e.g., population growth prediction, spatial optimization)
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
